text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on July 24. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Indonesia's rupiah strengthens after currency speculators drove it to an all time low earlier in the week.
Ousted Cambodian First Prime Minister Prince Norodom Ranariddh met Indonesian President Suharto at his residence on Wednesday night for 45 minutes.
Army chief-of-staff General Wiranto said the security situation in Indonesia at the moment was very "safe".
Central bank Governor Soedradjad Djiwandono said Bank Indonesia has spent $700 million to defend the rupiah this week and would intervene again if necessary.
